image.altText: Two men at a podium in the Prime Minister's Courtyard.

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese says the Iranian government directed antisemitic attacks on Australian soil. Follow live.

title.children: Iran 'orchestrated' at least two antisemitic attacks in Australia, Albanese says

image.altText: Police and paramedics assembled at Porepunkah where a police officer has been shot

props.synopsis: The public is being asked to avoid the scene, which has been described as an "active and ongoing incident which may present a significant risk to members of the public".

title.children: Two police officers killed in Victorian town

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Victoria Police say situation still ongoing
WATCH: The scene on the ground at Porepunkah

image.altText: Police at a round about

props.synopsis: Two police officers have been killed in a shooting at a rural property in Porepunkah in north-east Victoria.

title.children: Porepunkah in lockdown as police swarm after two killed

image.altText: White postal sack with red express post labelling

props.synopsis: Australia Post is taking the extraordinary step of immediately suspending many forms of shipping to the United States, as a Trump administration tariff deadline approaches on Friday.

title.children: Australia Post halts most parcel postage to US immediately

image.altText: A close up shot of a white man, dark brown hair, tense expression, white button up shirt, tie. Blurred green background.

props.synopsis: The prosecution has begun its closing arguments in the trial of Netflix star Matt Wright, now in its fourth week in the Northern Territory Supreme Court.

title.children: Prosecution begins closing arguments in Matt Wright trial

image.altText: A journalist wearing a press vest holds a camera that is covered with dust and blood

props.synopsis: If you ever need an indication of how quickly utterances from Donald Trump can ricochet from Washington to Jerusalem, his intervention in the latest devastating attack on a hospital in Gaza is a case in point.

title.children: Israel's response to killing of journalists highlights Trump's influence

image.altText: Beau Lamarre in a police uniform

props.synopsis: Beau Lamarre-Condon has been in custody since last February, when he was arrested after attending a Bondi police station following the disappearance of Jesse Baird and Luke Davies.

title.children: Former police officer pleads not guilty to murdering Sydney couple

image.altText: A close shot of Ley speaking.

props.synopsis: Opposition Leader Sussan Ley has played down tensions within the Coalition over its position on net zero, after a reportedly chaotic partyroom meeting where a number of MPs argued over the Coalition's climate position.

title.children: Sussan Ley plays down argument over net zero at Coalition partyroom meeting

image.altText: A lady's hands shown close up holding a letter from Aus Super

props.synopsis: At least 6.5 million Australians will have no say in who inherits their superannuation, according to new research from Super Consumers Australia. It is urging people to make sure they have a legally "binding" nomination to ensure their super goes to the people they want it to.

title.children: Millions of Australians will not have a say in who inherits their superannuation

image.altText: A man with a navy shirt stands in an elevator with his back to the camera. A mirror reflects his face showing he has glasses.

props.synopsis: David McWilliams took millions of dollars from investors by saying he was building houses for people with profound disabilities. Despite having his assets frozen, Four Corners can reveal he is still living a lavish lifestyle.

title.children: He's at the centre of a major fraud investigation. We tracked him down in an elevator

image.altText: Large flames engulf a building at night.

props.synopsis: Fire crews were unable to save the building despite an hours-long effort to stop the blaze.

title.children: 'Devastating' fire burns down Marshall Islands parliament building

image.altText: Trump makes an announcement on 2026 FIFA World Cup

props.synopsis: When Jerome Powell let slip that US monetary policy was restricting the economy, Donald Trump unleashed a wave of buying on both stock and debt markets.

title.children: How China is outmanoeuvring Trump on tariffs

image.altText: A white man with short brown hair and a pink polo shirt sitting in a wheelchair

props.synopsis: Jono Bredin was excited to be invited to speak at an inclusive housing summit, but soon found out there were no flights on any airline that could safely get him there.

title.children: The irony of being unable to attend an accessibility event due to inaccessible transport

image.altText: A young senator giving a speech to the upper house.

props.synopsis: Australia's youngest senator opens up about her experiences with depression and bullying as well as her concerns about her home state's algal bloom during a passionate and personal speech to federal parliament.

title.children: Youngest senator tells parliament something 'I've only told a handful'

image.altText: An image of a potato cut in half with rust coloured arcs inside on its flesh.

props.synopsis: Tracing operations are underway to determine the potential distribution of potato mop-top virus after a second case in a month has been detected in the state.

title.children: Potato trade restrictions 'likely' as Tasmanian detects second case of virus

image.altText: Students from the NCP in Bangladesh.

props.synopsis: Bangladesh's student uprising forced their prime minister to flee. Now they're trying to become a force for change from within the political system.

title.children: University students overthrew their country's dictator. Now comes the hard part

image.altText: man in suit rubbing hands together next to logo of a white x on black background

props.synopsis: The lawsuit alleges that Apple and OpenAI have "locked up markets to maintain their monopolies".

title.children: Musk's AI startup xAI sues Apple and ChatGPT maker

image.altText: RBA building

props.synopsis: The Reserve Bank's August interest rate meeting minutes show the the central bank is poised to lower interest rates 'faster' should the unemployment rate rise. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: RBA shifts focus from inflation to unemployment

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: AusPost halts most US postage but some operators continue
Equity Trustees says it's considering ASIC's claim
Reserve Bank poised to cut interest rates 'slightly faster'

image.altText: men huddled on the ground.

props.synopsis: Sextortion is becoming increasingly common in South-East Asia's scam compounds, with criminals moving into darker territory, alongside their usual romance and crypto cons.

title.children: Sextortion emerges as new tactic in South-East Asia's scam compounds

image.altText: Rio Ngumoha tugs on his Liverpool jersey in celebration

props.synopsis: Rio Ngumoha officially hits the football mainstream at 16 years of age after scoring a winner minutes into his English Premier League debut for reigning champions Liverpool.

title.children: Rio Ngumoha, the English prodigy who's scored a Premier League winner at 16

image.altText: Beck O'Connor wears a black dress and colourful earrings.

props.synopsis: Beck O'Connor has resigned following a report that laid bare issues at DVConnect during some of her time leading the helpline.

title.children: Queensland's victims' commissioner resigns after report into DV helpline

image.altText: A daughter and dad pose for a selfie photo.

props.synopsis: When Steven Jones was diagnosed with prostate cancer, his daughter Madeline didn't know anything about Australia's most diagnosed cancer for males. Now she is highlighting the impact of the disease.

title.children: Daughter's plea after young, fit dad loses prostate cancer battle

image.altText: Colourful image of vegetables, fruits, grain, nuts, dairy and meats.

props.synopsis: There's a growing trend for dietary guidelines around the world to take into account not just human health, but also the health of the planet.

title.children: New dietary guidelines are expected in 2026. Here's what they might contain

image.altText: CBA logo on black wall next to yellow tiled wall

props.synopsis: The Commonwealth Bank gave a problem gambler more than $13,000 in personal loans despite his transaction history with the bank showing he was spending as much as half his income on a months-long betting binge.

title.children: 'Back to their old tricks': Bank approved loans to problem gambler

image.altText: woman with hair tied back, black top, red scarf and blue backpack smiles on a platform over water and green scenery.

props.synopsis: Some migrants are changing names that do not fit standard Anglo-Saxon conventions, in order to avoid identity verification woes.

title.children: 'It's messed up': Immigrants struggle with names that don't fit the system

image.altText: Men in full bodied diving suits walk on a trail next to a sign and a large transmission tower

props.synopsis: Police divers have started searching a new location as part of its investigation into the murder Adelaide woman Rosemary Brown and the disappearance of her 15-year-old daughter Melissa Trussell.

title.children: Fresh search in mangroves amid cold case murder investigation

image.altText: Madison Keys sits with her head down at the US Open.

props.synopsis: Australian Open champion and hometown hope Madison Keys lets a big lead slip to go down in the first round of the US Open, as Petra Kvitova and Caroline Garcia wave goodbye.

title.children: Aus Open champion 'paralysed' by nerves in loss, as veterans bid teary farewell

image.altText: A concept drawing of the chocolate experience showing a large chocolate fountain.

props.synopsis: The dream of the "world's largest chocolate fountain" promised by the Tasmanian Liberal government in March last year has melted away from a project given $12 million in taxpayer funds.

title.children: 'World's largest chocolate fountain' dropped from developer plans at Cadbury

image.altText: Kilmar Abrego Garcia standing in a crowd with supporters.

props.synopsis: The Salvadoran migrant at the centre of a row over US President Donald Trump's hardline immigration policies was sent to a notorious jail and subsequently charged with offences his lawyers say are vindictive.

title.children: Wrongly deported Kilmar Abrego Garcia detained by ICE and now faces deportation to Uganda

image.altText: Hundreds of seagulls standing and flying outside Parliament House at nighttime.

props.synopsis: Hundreds of seagulls are ruffling feathers outside Parliament House, with the birds seeing the island in the middle of the forecourt water feature as a perfect nesting ground for their breeding season.

title.children: Seagulls reaching plague proportions outside Parliament House

image.altText: A young girl in a golden ball grown dress being crowned by an adult woman and man either side of her on a stage.

props.synopsis: From childhood crowns to adult advocacy, the world of Australian pageantry comes with opportunities and concerns.

title.children: Australian primary school student crowned Little Miss Universe

image.altText: Monterro Hill in a blue prison garment behind a door.

props.synopsis: The singer is facing three counts of battery of a police officer and one count of resisting an officer.

title.children: Lil Nas X pleads not guilty to assaulting police officers

image.altText: A school student sits against a row of lockers with their head in their hands.

props.synopsis: Support service Kids Helpline has received more than 1,000 reports from young people of abusive and controlling behaviour from peers, including friends.

title.children: More young people are reporting coercive control from peers
